this is often here to shape to the short row toe instep of the foot the shaping is either decreases top down socks or increases toe up sock either side of the top of the foot some short row heel socks don t have a gusset start of toe this is usually where a patterned top of foot will stop and a toe sole - this is often left in stockinette/stocking stitch will start in stockinette/stocking stitch so that so that it is smooth underneath the foot it is smooth and comfortable and fits inside a shoe some but not all of the most commonly used sock knitting terms cuff this is the very top part of the sock that circles the ankle usually it refers just to the ribbed edge of a sock but sometimes the whole leg of a sock can be referred to as the cuff double pointed needles these are needles that allow knitting in the round modern sets of double pointed needles most often have a set of 5 so you would arrange 4 of them in a square top to tail and use the 5th to knit in a continuous direction to form a tube more traditionally sock needles used to come in a set of 4 so that 3 were arranged in a triangle and the 4th is used to knit although using fewer needles can cause some tightness when turn- ing corners this method is still very popular because it makes sense when working a sock to divide stitches into heel front left and front right sections when knitting and helps a knitter to be more organised 2 flexible cast on/cast off this is often suggested at the very top edge of a sock because as stretchy as the main knit can be edges are often restricted and the cuff
